spell.name: Spectral Swords
entries: You conjure eight ethereal blades that surround you for the duration.
When you cast the spell—and as a bonus action on each of your turns thereafter—you can to direct up to four of the swords towards a target you can see within 60 feet.

When you do so, make a ranged spell attack for each sword. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} force damage and that sword then disappears. You can direct the swords to hit one creature or several.

Additionally until the spell ends you may use your reaction when hit by an attack to block it with two of the swords, increasing your AC by an amount equal to your spellcasting modifier against the triggering attack. Those swords then disappear.
The spell ends early if you have no swords remaining.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the spell creates four more swords for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Sermon of Swords
entries: {@i You invoke holy liturgies to call down a hail of divine swords upon your enemies.}
Three 5-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinders appear at points you choose within range. Each cylinder must be within 30 feet of another cylinder.

When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it is showered in glowing blades, and it must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes {@damage 2d6} piercing damage and {@damage 2d12} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

On each of your turns after you cast this spell, you can use an action to move up to two of the cylinders up to 60 feet to a new spot within range. A cylinder must be within 30 feet of another cylinder created by this spell, and a cylinders disappears if it exceeds the spell's range.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you create one additional cylinder for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Sacred Mercy
entries: Choose a number of creatures you can see within range up to your spellcasting modifier. For the duration of the spell each target regains 1 hit point at the start of their turn if they are within range and have no more than half of their hit points left.
However if a target starts their turn with 0 hit points and within range, they instead become stable if they are not already and the spell ends for them.
This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the healing increases by 1 for each slot level above 3rd.

m.text: holy water worth 25 gp, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Blessed Bulwark
entries: You touch a willing creature and holy light enshrouds the target, protecting them from harm. Until the spell ends, the target has resistance to either bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (your choice) from nonmagical attacks.

Additionally when the target takes damage of the chosen type from a creature within 60 feet of them that they can see, they can use their reaction to strike the creature with divine wrath. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw. It takes {@damage 2d12} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The spell then ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 2nd.

m.text: holy water worth 25 gp, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Denial of Divinity
entries: You point at one celestial, fey or fiend you can see within range and loudly rebuke its existence. They must succeed a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 5d8} psychic damage.

Additionally a creature who takes 30 or more psychic damage from this spell must make a Charisma saving throw at the start of their next turn; on a failed save, you banish it. If the target is native to a different plane of existence than the one you're on, the target disappears, returning to its home plane. If the target is native to the plane you're on, the creature vanishes into a harmless demiplane. While there, the target is {@condition incapacitated}. It remains there until the end of your next turn, at which point the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Equivalent Exchange
entries: You touch a sum of coinage that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube choosing a denomination of currency: Platinum Pieces, Gold Pieces, Electrum Pieces, Silver Pieces or Copper Pieces.

All the chosen coinage converts into the chosen denomination, maintaining the same total value. Any coinage not able to convert into a whole number of the chosen denomination, such as 9 silver pieces being changed into gold pieces, remains unchanged.

components.m: a sum of money in coinage

spell.name: Veil of Tears
entries: {@i Sketching a gesture in the air, you snatch the image of you from the minds of your foes, plucking it out and hiding you from sight.}

Until the spell ends, any creature who targets a creature under the effect of the spell with an attack or a harmful spell must first make a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check contested by your spell save DC. A creature automatically succeeds the check if it can perceive the creature with a special sense, such as {@sense blindsight}, {@sense tremorsense|MM} or {@sense truesight}.
On a failure, the creature must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This spell doesn't protect the target from area effects, such as the explosion of a fireball.
If a creature under the effect of the spell has makes an attack, casts a spell that affects an enemy, or deal damage to another creature, this spell ends for them.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature within 15 feet of you for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Dance of Shadows
entries: {@i You use your powers of illusion to exaggerate the play of light and shadow around a target. The effect swiftly intensifies, shrouding the target in a whirling vortex of gloom.}
Choose one willing creature you can see within range. Until the spell ends, creatures have disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks made to detect the target.

Additionally it is considered to be in half cover against ranged attacks even if it is in the open. If it is in cover, it is considered to be one degree more protective; for example if it is in half cover, it is considered to be three-quarters cover.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Enforce Reason
entries: You point at one aberration or monstrosity you can see within range and loudly rebuke its existence. They must succeed a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 5d8} necrotic damage.

Additionally a creature who takes 30 or more necrotic damage from this spell must make a Wisdom saving throw at the start of their next turn; shapechangers or a creature with 0 hit points automatically succeed this saving throw.

On a failed save, you change it into a new—more logical—form. The new form can be {@filter any beast|bestiary|type=beast|miscellaneous=!swarm} whose challenge rating is equal to or less than the target's (or the target's level, if it doesn't have a challenge rating). The target's game statistics, including mental ability scores, are replaced by the statistics of the chosen beast. It retains its alignment and personality.

The target assumes the hit points of its new form. When it reverts to its normal form, the creature returns to the number of hit points it had before it transformed. If it reverts as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to its normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce the creature's normal form to 0 hit points, it isn't knocked {@condition unconscious}.
The creature is limited in the actions it can perform by the nature of its new form, and it can't speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech.
The target's gear melds into the new form. The creature can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Summon Creature
entries: Choose a creature with which you are familiar within range. The creature you choose must be known to you, and it must be on the same plane of existence as you. Your familiarity with the creature determines whether you arrive there successfully. If the creature is unwilling it must make a Charisma saving throw. If the creature is willing, or if it fails the saving throw, the DM rolls {@dice d100} and consults the table.

entries.name: Familiarity
entries: "True Name" means the hidden name of a creature that, rather than just acting as a label, metaphysically truly belonged to that creature.

"Very familiar" is a creature you have seen very often, someone you are well acquainted with. "Seen casually" is a creature you have seen more than once but with which you aren't very familiar. "Viewed once" is a creature you have seen once, possibly using magic. "Description" is a creature whose location and appearance you know through someone else's description.

entries.name: On Target
entries: The summoned creature appears in an unoccupied space within 15 feet of you that's large enough to contain it.

entries.name: Off Target
entries: The summoned creature appears a random distance away from you in a random direction. Distance off target is {@dice 1d10 Ã— 1d10} percent of the distance that was to be traveled. For example, if the creature would have traveled 120 miles, landed off target, and rolled a 5 and 3 on the two {@dice d10}s, then it would be off target by 15 percent, or 18 miles. The DM determines the direction off target randomly by rolling a {@dice d8} and designating 1 as north, 2 as northeast, 3 as east, and so on around the points of the compass.

entries.name: Similar Creature
entries: Rather than the intended creature, a creature similar to the one you chose appears in an unoccupied space within 15 feet of you that's large enough to contain it. If you are attempting to summon a specific Gold Dragon, for example, you might instead wind up with another Gold Dragon; or if only using a description you may wind up with a different type of dragon entirely

entries.name: Failure
entries: The spell's unpredictable magic results in a failure with the spell slot and the components used in the spell wasted.

components.m: diamond dust worth at least 5,000 gp, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Chains of Light

components.m: a small section of chain blessed by holy water

entries: Chains comprised of pure golden light seize one creature you choose that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained} and {@condition incapacitated} for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Strength saving throw to escape the chains. On a success, the spell ends.
Until the spell ends, you can use your action on each of your turns to automatically deal {@damage 1d10} radiant damage to the target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Peal of Discord
entries: {@i Drawing in a slow breath of arcane energy, you throw back your head and sing out a perfect note, interwoven with a horrific banshee scream. Soaring and plunging, the wave of sound rolls outward, a crashing discordia that shatters bones, bursts brains and leaves the few survivors bleeding and befuddled.}

Each creature within 10 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save they take {@damage 2d6} thunder damage and are {@condition incapacitated} until the end of their next turn; on a successful save they take half as much damage and aren't {@condition incapacitated}.
In addition, a nonmagical object made of glass that isn't being worn or carried also takes the damage if it's in the spell's area, and the sound of the spell is audible out to 300 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Shards of Light
entries: {@i You reach out and pluck blades of light from thin air. Through nothing but illusion, this trick is so realistic that it fools the senses utterly, the blades inflicting horrific psychosomatic wounds as they whistle through the air to blind and impale.}
You create two shards of light and launch them at targets within range. You can launch them at one target or several.
Make a ranged spell attack for each shard. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} psychic damage and is {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you create one additional shard for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Fog of Dreams
entries: {@i Soft and subtle, you send your consciousness forth like a creeping mist that seeps into the thoughts of your foe, veiling their sight and baffling their senses with whirling bank of lambent silver mist.}

Choose one creature you can see within range, they must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, until the spell ends the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls, is {@condition deafened} and anything it attempts to perceive is considered to be {@quickref Vision and Light|PHB|2||lightly obscured}.
At the end of each of its turns, the target can make an Intelligence saving throw. On a success, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Laugh of Sorrows
entries: {@i You send barbed strands of pure malice to plunge into the mind of your foe. With your victim snared you draw forth unnatural mirth within their psyche with each twitch of your fingers, causing them to howl and shriek with laughter before you suddenly tear our the barbs and plunge them into heart-stopping misery.}

Choose one creature you can see within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save it takes a number of {@damage d8} equal to the amount it failed the save by (minimum of {@dice 1d8}) in bludgeoning damage. On a successful save it takes half as much damage and the spell ends.

At the start of its next turn it must make another Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save it takes a number of {@damage d6} equal to the amount it failed the save by (minimum of {@dice 1d6}) in psychic damage, or half as much on a successful save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Mirror of Minds
entries: {@i You appear to your foe as a deadly apparition, reality falling away before the helpless victim as its replaced by a warped mirror-maze of your making.}

Choose one target you can see within range. When you cast this spell and as a bonus action on each of your turns until it ends you can force the target to make an opposed check using your spellcasting ability.
If you succeed, the target becomes {@condition blinded} until the spell ends and takes psychic damage equal to {@dice 4d8} plus the difference between your rolls.
If the target succeeds the check or is outside the spell's range at the end of your turn, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Zzapp!
entries: A crackling line of lightning 30 feet long and 5 feet wide bursts forth from you in a direction you choose.
Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d8} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Additionally when a creature in the line fails their saving throw, each creature within 10 feet of them (potentially including you) must also make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d8} lightning damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Meteoric Jump
entries: Choose one creature you can see within range; you, and one other willing creature of your size or smaller within 5 feet of you, teleport to an unoccupied space up to 30 feet above the target.
You, and any creature you brought with you, then fall onto the target unless you have means to prevent your falling.

The creature you chose and each creature within 5 feet of them must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save they take {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning damage for every 5 feet you fell and are knocked {@condition prone}, or they take half as much and are not knocked {@condition prone} on a successful save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can bring one additional willing creature with you and the height you can teleport up to increases by 10 feet for each spell slot above 3rd.

spell.name: Frazzle
entries: {@i You send out arcs of crackling electro-psychic energy that ground themselves upon the enemy, reducing them to shrivelled husks.}

Choose a point you can see within range, each creature within 10 feet of it must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d4} lightning damage and {@damage 2d4} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature made of or wearing metal has disadvantage on this saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the lightning damage increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: 'Eadbanger
entries: {@i A violent bolt of power erupts from your forehead and rockets across the battlefield, causing the head of the first unfortunate victim caught in its path to explode in a shower of brains and gore.}

The nearest hostile creature to you that you can see within range must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save they take {@damage 1d10} lightning damage and {@damage 2d6} psychic damage, or half as much damage on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the lightning damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Warpath
entries: {@i You disperse violent energy coursing through your frame into your allies around you, stirring a bellicose, warlike nature within them to a roaring fever pitch.}

Choose a willing creature that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, the target can only use its bonus action to make one melee weapon attack. If the creature ends its turn without making an attack with its bonus action, it takes {@damage 1d4} psychic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Power Vomit
entries: {@i Maw yawning wide, you vomit a roiling tide of searing green psycho-plasma that burns through everything in its path, leaving nothing but scorched earth and fluorescent embers in its wake.}

Each creature in a 60-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d12} fire damage and {@damage 2d10} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the fire damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Killbolt
entries: {@i A crackling surge of energy lances forth from your eye sockets, anything in its path is reduced to a pile of glowing green embers.}

The lance of energy forms a beam 30 feet long, 5 feet wide and blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d10} lightning damage and {@damage 2d10} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
If damage from this spell kills a target, the target and all of its nonmagical belongings are turned to ash.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the lightning damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Krunch
entries: {@i You conjure a huge ectoplasmic vision of either a giant, warty green fist or foot that pummels the foe into a mushy paste.}

The conjuration slams down in {@dice 2d6} different points of your choice that you can see within range. Each creature within a 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder around the chosen point must succeed a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save they take {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 1d12} force damage, or half as much on a successful save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Wrack
entries: One creature of your choice you can see within range experiences a jolt of searing pain and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the target takes {@damage 1d4} psychic damage and {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage.
This spell's psychic and necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d4} each when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d4} each), 11th level ({@damage 3d4} each), and 17th level ({@damage 4d4} each).

components.m: a tear from a child

spell.name: Wither
entries: {@i With dark chanting you cast a spell of wasting, shrinking sickness and corrosion.}

Choose one target within range, they must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, until the spell ends the target's Constitution score is reduced by 3 and their movement speed is halved. The target dies if this reduces its Constitution to 0. The decrease to the target's Constitution also decreases its maximum hit points, the amount it decreases by is also removed from its current hit points; this lasts until the spell ends.
At the end of each of the target's turns, it can make a Constitution saving throw against the spell. On a success, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Weeping World Sores
entries: {@i At your wretched word, the world itself begins to bubble and boil with toxic pus.}

Choose a point on the ground you can see within range. Each creature in a 15-foot-radius hemisphere centered on that point must make a Constitution saving throw. A target takes {@damage 6d6} poison damage and {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned} on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Warpstorm
entries: {@i You summon a sudden storm of green and black lightning that is formed of pure arcane energy, its deadly bolts striking your foes.}

Choose a point you can see within range. Each creature in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 5d6} lightning damage and {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

Additionally a creature who takes 10 or more necrotic damage from this spell must make a Constitution saving throw; on a failed save they become {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn.

components.m: a copper likeness of the horned rat

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the lightning and necrotic damage both increase by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Warp Lightning

components.m: a slender copper rod

entries: A bolt of greenish-black lightning arcs toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d4} lightning damage and {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage. You have advantage on the attack roll if the target is wearing armour made of metal.

The spell creates more than one bolt when you reach higher levels: two bolts at 5th level, three bolts at 11th level, and four bolts at 17th level. You can direct the bolts at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each bolt.

spell.name: Vermintide
entries: A great swarm of rats erupts from you in a direction you choose forming a line 60 feet long and 15 feet wide. Make a melee spell attack against each creature in the line, on a hit the target takes {@damage 5d6} piercing damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

components.m: a wheel of good cheese

spell.name: Vector
entries: Choose one creature you can see within range, they must succeed a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has disadvantage on saving throws against diseases for 1 minute.
This spell's duration increases when you reach certain levels: 10 minutes at 5th level, 1 hour at 11th level, and 8 hours at 17th level.

components.m: a wad of dung

spell.name: Scorch
entries: {@i You thrust your hands into the ground while chittering fiery incantations, causing a great gout of green flame to burst forth.}

Choose a point on the ground you can see within range. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius, 20-foot-high cylinder centered around that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. Creatures gain no benefit from cover, except full cover, against this spell. A target takes {@damage 2d12} fire damage and {@damage 1d12} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

Additionally a creature who takes 10 or more fire damage from this spell must also make a Wisdom saving throw; on a failed save, it must immediately use its reaction, if available, to move as far as its speed allows away from you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the fire damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Rat Thrall

m.text: a bit of mouldy cheese, which the spell consumes

entries: You gain the service of a {@creature rat} thrall. Appearing in an unoccupied space within range, the thrall has the statistics of a {@creature rat}.
Your thrall acts independently of you, but it always obeys your commands. In combat, it rolls its own initiative and acts on its own turn.
When the thrall drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends, it disappears, leaving behind no physical form and it leaves behind in its space anything it was wearing or carrying.
Until this spell ends you are able to comprehend and verbally communicate with the thrall for the duration as if you share a language.

spell.name: Plague
entries: {@i You unleash a vile disease that scours the battlefield in search of victims to infect.}

Choose one creature that you can see within range to make a Constitution saving throw. It takes {@damage 3d6} poison damage and {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
Then, roll on the following table:

rows.name: Backfire!
entries: The nearest creature to the current target that is friendly to you (including yourself) and within range becomes the new target of the spell and it must a Constitution saving throw as if it was the original target of the spell.
If there is more than one possible target, the DM chooses between the targets. If there are no valid targets within range, the spell ends.
Then, roll on this table again.

rows.name: Dissipate
entries: The spell ends with no further effect.

rows.name: Spread!
entries: The nearest creature to the current target that is hostile to you and within range becomes the new target of the spell and it must a Constitution saving throw as if it was the original target of the spell.
If there is more than one possible target, you choose between the targets. If there are no valid targets within range, the spell ends.
Then, roll on this table again.
A creature can only be the target of this spell once each time it is cast.

components.m: a sprinkling of several dead fleas

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Pestilent Breath
entries: You exhale a pestilent, poisonous cloud at your enemies. Each creature in a 30-foot cone must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes {@damage 8d4} poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned} on a successful one. The {@condition poisoned} creature may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition poisoned} condition on a success.

components.m: a stick of warpstone incense lit at both ends

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Howling Warpgale
entries: {@i You gesture twitchingly to the skies and fierce hurricane gales begin to build, swirling around you and making flight impossible.}
A strong wind (40 miles per hour) blows around you in a 15-foot radius and moves with you, remaining centered on you. The wind lasts for the spell's duration.
The wind has the following effects:

items: It {@condition deafened||deafens} you and other creatures in its area.
It extinguishes unprotected flames in its area that are torch-sized or smaller.
It hedges out vapor, gas, and fog that can be dispersed by strong wind.
The area is {@quickref difficult terrain|PHB|3} for creatures other than you.
The attack rolls of ranged weapon attacks have disadvantage if the attacks pass in or out of the wind.

When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed a Strength saving throw of be knocked {@condition prone}. A flying creature has disadvantage on this saving throw.
Creatures within the radius are considered lightly obscured.

spell.name: Ghostly Flame

components.m: a pinch of warpstone dust

entries: You conjure a small blob of glowing, green fire out of thin air that drips viscous fluid as it burns. The flame remains there for the duration and harms neither you nor your equipment. The flame sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. The spell ends if you dismiss it as an action or if you cast it again.

You can also attack with the flame, although doing so ends the spell. When you cast this spell, or as an action on a later turn, you can hurl the flame at a creature within 30 feet of you. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d4} fire damage and {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage.
This spell's fire and necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d4} each when you reach 5th level ({@damage 2d4} each), 11th level ({@damage 3d4} each), and 17th level ({@damage 4d4} each).

spell.name: Flensing Ruin
entries: Three green ribbons of warpstone-derived energy tear the flesh from the target's bones.
Make a ranged spell attack for each bolt. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} lightning damage and {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you create one additional bolt for each slot level above 2nd.

components.m: a piece of tanned skin from a human, elf or dwarf

spell.name: Favour

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw with advantage

entries: {@i You steal the fortune of others and use it for your own gain.}
The triggering creature gains disadvantage on the roll, negating its advantage.
You then gain advantage on the next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw you make within 1 minute. You can be empowered by only one use of this spell at a time.

components.m: a bit of flesh from a humanoid creature

spell.name: Death Frenzy
entries: {@i Gesticulating wildly, you gift creatures with a rabid and frothing urge to close in, attack, and consume.}

Choose a number of willing creatures you can see up to your spellcasting modifier. Until the spell ends, the targets may use their bonus action to make an additional weapon attack when they make a weapon attack on their turn.
However they also take {@damage 2d10} necrotic damage, which can't be reduced in any way, at the end of each of their turns.

components.m: two drops of blood from a rabid animal

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or 5th level, a target may make two attacks with their bonus action instead of one and the necrotic damage increases to {@damage 4d10}. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th or 7th level, a target may make three attacks with their bonus action instead of one and the necrotic damage increases to {@damage 6d10}. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, a target may make four attacks with their bonus action instead of one and the necrotic damage increases to {@damage 8d10}.

spell.name: Crack's Call
entries: {@i With the arcane incantation invoked, you cast the spell by stamping your foot, causing the very ground to split asunder.}
The ground in a line 60 feet long and 15 feet wide splits open, creating a chasm up to 40 feet deep. The area within the chasm becomes difficult terrain.

Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save the creature takes {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage, becomes {@condition prone} and falls to the bottom of the chasm. On a successful save the creature does not fall {@condition prone} and moves to the nearest space not occupied by the chasm.

spell.name: Cloud of Corruption
entries: {@i You release a stinking blast of diseased fury.}

Each creature within 15 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 4d6} poison damage and {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned} on a successful one.
A {@condition poisoned} creature may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition poisoned} condition on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Bless with Filth
entries: {@i You touch a nonmagical weapon, imbuing it with noxious poisons.}
Until the spell ends, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d4} poison damage to any target hit by the weapon. If the weapon isn't magical, it becomes a magic weapon for the spell's duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for every two slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Crackling Doom
entries: You send a single crackling arc of green energy at a creature you can see within range, they must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the creature takes {@damage 1d6} lightning damage, {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage, is {@condition incapacitated} and has a speed of 0 until the start of your next turn; taking half as much damage, not being {@condition incapacitated} or having their speed reduced on a successful save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the lightning damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

components.m: a coil of copper wire

spell.name: Armour of Darkness
entries: You solidify the shadows around your body. Your base AC becomes 13 + your Dexterity modifier, and increases by 1 if you are in dim light or darkness. The spell ends if you don armor or if you dismiss the spell as an action.
Additionally you have advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks until the spell ends.

components.m: A piece of blackened leather

spell.name: Black Whirlwind

components.m: a glass vial filled with ash

entries: You summon a putrid whirlwind of vile smoke and stinging ashes in a 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on a point within range. The whirlwind's area is {@quickref Vision and Light|PHB|2||lightly obscured}.
Each creature that is completely within the cylinder at the start of its turn must make a Constitution saving throw.
On a failed save a creature takes {@dice 1d8} fire damage, {@damage 1d8} poison damage and has disadvantage on attack rolls, and Dexterity saving throws until the start of their next turn.
On each of your turns after you cast this spell, you can use an action to move the whirlwind up to 30 feet in any direction.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the fire and poison damage each increase by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Buoyant Passage
entries: Until the spell ends you gain the ability to move across any liquid surface—such as water, acid, mud, snow, quicksand, or lava—as if it were solid ground (creatures crossing liquids such as acid or lava can still take damage from touching it).

components.m: a piece of cork

spell.name: Divine Winged Lance
entries: You conjure a holy lance as glowing feathered wings sprout from your back and carry you up to 15 feet into the air. You then swiftly strike forward in a line up to 30 feet long and 5 feet wide, moving to the other end of it.
Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw, on a failed save they take {@damage 1d12} piercing damage and {@damage 3d8} radiant damage or half as much on a successful save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the radiant damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

m.text: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

spell.name: Reaping Blow
entries: You summon a large spectral, skeletal scythe and swing it in a single deadly motion. Each creature in a 30-foot cone must make a Strength saving throw.
On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d4} slashing damage, {@damage 2d10} necrotic damage, is knocked {@condition prone} and has a speed of 0 until the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

components.m: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

spell.name: Discus of Light
entries: You conjure a glowing halo of light and hurl it at a creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target.
On a hit a target takes {@damage 2d4} slashing damage and {@damage 1d4} radiant damage.

Hit or miss, the discus returns to you; make another ranged spell attack against a different creature within range that's closer to you than the first target and no more than 60 feet from it. The discus then disappears.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level of higher, the radiant damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Putrefy
entries: With a flourish and a curse, you cause an amount of food to rot and decay, rendering it totally inedible.
All nonmagical food and drink within a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on a point of your choice within range becomes rotten and inedible.

components.m: a handful of rotten grain

spell.name: Toxic Rain
entries: Calling upon the power of the Horned Rat, you conjure a poisonous cloud that appears in the shape of a cylinder that is 10 feet tall with a 30-foot radius, centered on a point you can see within range directly above you. The spell fails if you can't see a point in the air where the poisonous cloud could appear (for example, if you are in a room that can't accommodate the cloud).

When you cast this spell you can choose a number of creatures up to your spellcasting modifier (minimum of 1) that you can see and are fully within the cylinder, the chosen creatures must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save they fall {@condition unconscious} until the spell ends, the target takes damage (except from this spell), or someone uses an action to shake or slap the target awake.

When any creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 1d4} poison damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

components.m: a baby cave viper

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Speed Read
entries: Placing a hand on a book, scroll or other similar object you create a mental record of all the information within.

Until the spell ends you can perfectly recall any of the information from the object; however if it is in a language you don't understand you are only able to vividly picture the contents but gain no understanding of their meaning.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of a higher level, the duration increases to 8 hours with a 3rd-level slot, to 1 day with a 5th-level slot, to 30 days with an 7th-level slot, and to a year and a day with a 9th-level spell slot.

spell.name: Thunderous Slam
entries: Manifesting a massive maul, you slam it down on a point of your choice within range. Every other creature within 15 feet of the point must make a Constitution saving throw.

On a failed save they take {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage, {@damage 4d6} thunder damage and are pushed 10 feet back from the chosen point. A creature that fails the save by 5 or more also falls {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

m.text: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the thunder damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Shining Volley
entries: Drawing back a spectral string a shining longbow appears in your hands. Choose a number of creatures up to your spellcasting modifier (minimum of 1)  you can see within range, each target must make a Dexterity saving throw.

On a failed save a target takes {@damage 1d8} piercing damage, {@damage 4d4} force damage, is {@condition blinded} and it sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet until the end of its next turn, or it takes half as much damage, isn't {@condition blinded} and doesn't shed light on a successful save.

components.m: a ranged weapon worth at least 1 sp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or higher level, the damage increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Chaotic Burst
entries: You conjure chaotic energies and launch them at one creature or object you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} damage. The number rolled on the {@dice d8} determines the attack's damage type, as shown below.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

From 5th level, when determining the damage type you can choose any of the {@dice d8}s. If you roll the same number on two {@dice d8}s, you can roll a {@dice d6} and add it to the damage, up to a maximum of {@dice 3d6}.

spell.name: Arc Flash
entries: With a sudden spark, bolts of lightning streak out to creatures within 15 feet of you. Each creature within range must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature has disadvantage on the saving throw if it is wearing armour made of metal.

Roll {@dice 6d6}; the total is how much lightning damage the spell deals, divide the total as you choose between each creature within range (minimum of 0). You cannot allocate more than half the total rolled to a single creature that succeeded the saving throw.
A creature that fails the saving throw and takes at least 1 point of damage from this spell can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Cognitive Dissonance
entries: You touch a humanoid creature. It must make a Wisdom saving throw, and does so with advantage if you or your companions are fighting it. If it fails the saving throw, it is {@condition charmed} by you until the spell ends or until you or your companions do anything harmful to it.

While {@condition charmed} the creature perceives any event in which you are involved in either an entirely positive or negative light (your choice when you cast the spell). When pressed the creature will attempt to rationalize their new opinion of you.
When the spell ends, the creature knows it was {@condition charmed} by you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher the duration increases to 8 hours, or to 24 hours when cast with a spell slot of 6th level or higher and to 7 days when cast with a spell slot of 8th level or higher.

spell.name: Rings of Light
entries: Three 5-foot-diameter glowing rings of light appear in unoccupied spaces of your choice within range and last for the duration. Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of a ring must make a Dexterity saving throw. The creature takes {@damage 2d6} slashing damage and {@damage 1d6} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

As an action, you can move each ring up to 30 feet in any direction. If you ram a ring into a creature, that creature must make the saving throw against the ring's damage, and the ring stops moving this turn.
When you move a ring it cannot pass through solid objects, however it otherwise moves as if it was flying. Each ring sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you create one additional ring for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Blazing Tempest

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the lightning damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 5th.
{@i You unleash a storm of crackling lightning bolts that rain down upon your enemies, a fury so fierce it ignites the very air and ground where it strikes.}

The storm appears in a location you choose within range and the area of the storm consists of up to ten 5-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinders, which you can arrange as you wish. Each cylinder must touch the ground and have at least one edge adjacent to the edge of another cylinder.

Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature has disadvantage on this saving throw if it is wearing armour made of metal. It takes {@damage 5d8} lightning damage and {@damage 2d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Additionally the ground in the spell's area is engulfed in fire and becomes difficult terrain for the duration. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there it must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d6} fire damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.
